intro: Thibaudia rhodoroides, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
